title: Dashboard Study
description: During March 2025 to March 2026, I worked as a researcher on a project that involved designing fair and inclusive Learning Analytics Dashboards (LADs). I developed four prototype LADs using HTML, CSS and JavasScript (with Vue), which were tested by university students and teachers.
imageAltText: A screenshot of alearning analytics dashboard that shows students' scores in a course.

title: Inhibitors and Enablers
description: This projects presents results from my analysis of interviews that I conducted with primary school teachers in 2018, as part of my PhD research. I used TypeScript and Phaser.js to create the interactive project, which allows you to explore my research results.
imageAltText: A screenshot of a tool that visualises findings from Daniel Hickmott's PhD study.

title: Memory Trick Widget
description: I created a simple widget that can be used to generate images for passphrases, as a way to help people remember their passphrases. I wrote a Python script to generate images for all the passphrases that can be generated with the widget and used HTML/JavaScript to create the widget.
imageAltText: A white tiger infront of a mirror and next to a mug in cartoon style, the image has been generated with AI.

title: MEd (Digital Technologies)
description: I lectured in the Master of Education (Digital Technologies) at the University of Sydney, working with the Australian Computing Academy. This program was for teachers upskilling for and leading the implementation of the Digital Technologies curriculum.
imageAltText: A person's hands, with one hand writing in a notebook and the other on a laptop that shows students in a video chat, in cartoon style.

title: Coding in Stage 3
description: I developed and ran a sustained professional learning program for primary school teachers, as part of my PhD study's data collection. My PhD project involved measuring the program's impact on participating teachers' coding knowledge, confidence about teaching coding, and plans for integrating coding across the curriculum.
imageAltText: A grid with a beetle that is at the origin point (0,0) and a purple dot at the point (4,2).

title: Literacy Apps
description: I worked with a team of educators and engineers to develop the iOS versions of the Apostrophe Power and Sentence Hero mobile learning apps. I also applied Serious Games Analytics to data collected through the Apostrophe Power app to gain understanding about how players interacted with the app.
imageAltText: A screenshot from the Sentence Hero game, showing a penguin jumping over a rolling boulder.

title: Coding and STEM 4 Schools
description: From 2013 to 2019, I worked with a team of educators and engineers to prepare resources for and co-ordinate a variety of professional learning programs for upskilling teachers for the Digital Technologies curriculum.
imageAltText: The cartoon Scratch cat next to two Scratch coding blocks. One block says 'When green flag clicked' and the other says 'say Coding!'.
